meanings: [명사] defeat, [동사] be defeated, be beaten, lose, suffer[sustain] a defeat
wipe out the stain[disgrace] of a former defeat

examples.korean: There was an inevitability about their defeat. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그들의 패배에는 불가피한 면이 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: There was an inevitability about their defeat. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: They had been badly bruised by the defeat. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그들은 그 패배로 몹시 의기소침해져 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: They had been badly bruised by the defeat. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: He was jettisoned as team coach after the defeat. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 패배 후 그는 팀 코치 자리에서 버림받았다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He was jettisoned as team coach after the defeat. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: They inflicted a humiliating defeat on the home team. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그들은 홈 팀에게 치욕스러운 패배를 안겨 주었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: They inflicted a humiliating defeat on the home team. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: After its election defeat, the party needs to regroup. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 선거에서 패배한 후이므로 그 정당은 조직을 재정비할 필요가 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: After its election defeat, the party needs to regroup. Add to Wordbook
